page.title: 03St Ives coastguard interview
page.content: The coast road runs to the North Cliffs here. The cliffs are high and shaley - unsafe for amateurs - although the professional climbers who restrict their climbs to the granite - rarely provide work for the coastguard. Elderly people use the parking places along the cliffs as a base for picnics and gentle walks. There are three small beaches which may be approached by steep footpaths but are now only visited by a few informed local people. Seals breed along these cliffs and fishermen from St Ives approaching by sea, lay nets here and leave lobster and crab pots. Hells mouth is a local suicide area. At one place along this stretch people keep dumping rubbish and old cars.
